metadata.title: CVE-2018-20022 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
LibVNC before 2f5b2ad1c6c99b1ac6482c95844a84d66bb52838 contains multipleweaknesses CWE-665: Improper Initialization vulnerability in VNC clientcode that allows attacker to read stack memory and can be abuse forinformation disclosure. Combined with another vulnerability, it can be usedto leak stack memory layout and in bypassing ASLR

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libvncserver-config - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

italc-client - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
italc-management-console - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
italc-master - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
libitalccore - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
italc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1').
ssvnc package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
tightvnc package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
